metadata.title: AI Act Guide for SMEs and Startups

overview.purpose: Simplified guidance for small and medium-sized enterprises navigating the AI Act
overview.applicability: All businesses developing, deploying, or distributing AI systems in the EU

keySimplifications.simplification: Microenterprises may implement proportionate, simplified QMS without reducing protection levels

keySimplifications.benefit: Reduced documentation burden for low-risk applications
Reduced conformity assessment fees for SMEs and startups
Priority access to test AI innovations under supervision

step1.title: Classify Your AI System
questions: Does your AI system fall under prohibited practices? (If yes, STOP)
Is it a high-risk system under Annex III?
Is it embedded in a product under Annex I?
Is it a GPAI model or system?

roles.if: You develop or have developed the AI and market it under your name
You use AI systems in your business operations
You make AI systems available without development
You bring third-country AI into EU market

dates.now: Prohibited practices and AI literacy already apply

commonMistakes.reality: Most AI systems are minimal or limited risk
Prohibited practices and AI literacy already apply
Logs and documentation are required for many systems

immediate: Inventory all AI systems in use
by2026: Register in EU database if required
